4 It is to inform that during the review meeting held on 21 .01.2025 under the
chairmanship DG/CISF on various issues/agenda of Airport Sector, it has been
directed that physical capacity enhancement of QRT should be done in the line
with NSG/SPG.

3. It is pertinent to mention that as per BCAS Circular No 04/2023 QRT of
ASGICISF has been mandated with the following responsibilities:

_"QRT members will be tasked for cordoning off the aircraft during
exigency and also counter-action against terrorists in case of any
contingency requiring storming of the aircraft of action inside the
terminal building” :

4. Accordingly, 202 QRT personnel from various ASGs attended a two-week
training program at NSG Training Centre, Manesar/Samalkha, from 19.08.2024 to
31.08.2024. Further, NSG has been approached to conduct more such courses
for ASG QRT personnel in 2025.

5. ASG QRT personnel, being the first responder at airports, need to respond
in accordance with the mandates assigned by the BCAS in case of any hijack
situation at the airports. Therefore, it is necessary for all QRT personnel to
maintain their regular physical fitness level.

6. Further, APS Hars vide letter ibid, has already issued detailed directions
for conducting the BPET for all QRT personnel every month to maintain their
endurance, strength, speed & flexibility enabling them to respond swiftly and
effectively in emergencies.
